descriptionNullable:
1. Ophthalmic Datasets from Kaggle: 
Kaggle hosts a variety of medical image datasets, including those related to ophthalmology. While not always specific to cataracts, these datasets can be a good starting point. You can find datasets such as the "Diabetic Retinopathy Detection" dataset which may include cataract images as part of the broader set of eye disease images.

2. NIH Eye Image Data:
 The National Institutes of Health (NIH) provides various medical image datasets, including those related to eye conditions. They have datasets with fundus images that can be used for cataract detection and classification.

3. Mendeley Data:
 Mendeley hosts datasets published by researchers. For example, a dataset titled "A Dataset for Cataract Detection" includes images and may provide annotations for cataract severity.

4. Publications and Supplementary Data: 
Research papers often release their datasets for public use. Searching for recent publications on cataract detection and classification in journals like IEEE, Nature, or medical image analysis journals can lead to finding datasets. Supplementary materials or direct requests to the authors can sometimes yield access to these datasets.

5. Medical Image Databases: 
Large medical image databases like the Digital Retinal Images for Vessel Extraction (DRIVE) database, Structured Analysis of the Retina (STARE), and others may have relevant images. While these databases are often focused on retinal images, they can include cases with cataracts as well.

6. Private Datasets:
 Collaborations with hospitals or ophthalmology clinics can provide access to private datasets. These collaborations often involve data-sharing agreements and ethical clearances but can provide high-quality, annotated images for research.

For practical purposes, here are some specific examples and links to datasets:

- Cataract Grading Dataset(Kaggle):
 A dataset specifically aimed at grading cataracts. [Link to Kaggle Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets)
- **NIH Clinical Center**: [NIH Open Access Data](https://clinicalcenter.nih.gov/)
title: Cataract Classification Dataset in DS
